comment: HORRIBLE! DO NOT TAKE!

If you use the math lab and can afford an occasional tutoring session, this is a very good class. Not good at explaining but has his own website which i LOVE. STRAIGHTFORWARD about what is expected. ORGANIZED. You know when all the "pop" quizzes are. Very fast w grading. Drops 2 quizzes and a test. Studied from the book and the website. Made an A.
Awful teacher,I was frequently  more confused after he explained things,his teaching style was dull, and he can't hear some higher pitched female voices. (he said that in class)

He is the worst professor I have ever had. If you get him... DROP the class! He gave me a C of a 79.99 and then would not make an appointment with me and barely responded to emails. He is old and creepy and talks funny and is VERY hard of hearing. Also, when asked to clarify he repeated it the exact same way as before.

Horrible. Not only is he socially inept and won't be able to answer any of your questions because he acts like english is his 4th language, but his grading methods are frustrating and you get no homework grades to have a foundation for your total grade. Worst teaching I've ever encountered. NEVER TAKE HIM.

Horrible professor. I wish I never would have taken his class. The class was Trig. He is good at math, but CANNOT TEACH. You only get credit if you do the problems EXACTLY like him- he calls it "proper math grammar." What HE calls a quiz, the rest of the world calls a POP QUIZ. you never know when your going to have one. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

I am changing my major because of this man and hope that he reads these and sees the utter despair that he puts students through. i complained to the math board at Kennesaw, but since he has tenure they cant fire him, this is the closest ive come to hating a person in a very long time. its not worth taking even if its the last class left.

You get 4tests(drop1).If you make the slightest mistake its wrong.Its not enough to get the right answer,has to be his way.You get pop quizes and they are just 2questions to a quiz and out of 12 points.So if you miss one question,you fail.Its so hard to get a good grade.I never made above a 9 out of 12 on a quiz.You take 12quizes and get to drop 2.

He can't hear anything so your questions won't be answered. He takes off points for not doing things his way even though he acts like he's very opened minded. His grading is stupid and inconsistent. He'll take off 5 points on one question and 4 on the next for the EXACT SAME THING. It's in Kennesaw's best interest to get rid of him.

I went to my first class freshmen year and it was Degler. Instead of telling us what his class would be about, he spent the whole class time giving us examples of reasons certain people shouldn't take the class. Math is one of my best subjects, but he scared me so much that I went home and dropped the class. He did say that attendance was mandatory

horrible teacher. In highschool i thought trig was easy and really enjoyed it, so i thought why not take it in college? i regret that decision everyday because of this teacher. I teach myself the material at home, he is never clear and never uses examples, and even if you understand the material, due to his grading techniques you rarely pass a test

Seriously the worst teacher i have ever had. He can never explain why he takes off points. He makes you use a check list and then says your cheating when you pull out HIS check list. He gives quizes over stuff even when all this kids tell him they do NOT understand what he is teaching. Talks about randon stuff that isn't important. HORRRIIBBLLLEE!!

by far the worst teacher ive ever had...i did well in every math class ive ever done but BOMBED this one...not dude to lack of effort...just do to lack of this guys teaching ability. he is so confusing and his grading is unexplainable. i once got 20 points off on a 10 point question for literally showing extra scratch work on the quiz. AVOID!!!

Terrible teacher, only class I've taken where you can have the answer correct, but still get the problem wrong. Unless you get the answer his way, and only his way is it correct. Doesn't really teach, only shows what his way is and if you don't use it too bad. Takes points if you don't show a step or combine two steps.
Horrible horrible professor having to take class again

This professor has a dry sense of humor.  I'm a math major but taking made me want to change my major.  He takes points off for everything even though you might have gotten the problem.  Put it this way "It his way or you can hit the highway" Do not take this guy unless you have a clear understanding of the material already.  4/30/10

Ive neverrrrr been a bad math person, never made below a B, and he made me feel like an idiot. Get out now! He is not clear about things, and is very specific about EVERYTHING. Was not a good experience.

He's a pretty good prof. Attendance isn't mandatory but going to class is really important. 4 tests with the lowest dropped and he builds in 20 extra points for each one. 8 POP quizzes with 2 lowest dropped. Tests are 60%, quizzes are 15%, and the final is 25%. The final wasn't bad. I'm not good at math and I got an A so it's definitely possible.

Not the best prof. He says he does not want to see your work, but when you do your work you have to do it a certain way. His grading is inconsistant. He will take a certain amount of points off for an error, but then take a different amount of points off for that same error in a different problem. I would not recommend taking him.

Not the greatest professor. Believes in "proper math grammar" which means you must do it exactly his way. Once you get how he wants it, it's not too terrible. Quiz questions are from notes and homework problems.Tests aren't that bad either, except for the whole no scratch work thing. I do not recommend him if you struggle with math at all.

He's a nice professor but has specifications in how he wants his problems done which can be frustrating at times. He appreciates it if students speak up in class and don't fall asleep. If you want to make a decent grade, sit up front, pay attention, and speak up. He'll be lenient to those who do that. And also, doing the homework helps tremendously

HORRIBLE PROFESSOR! DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF! Must learn ?his math.? If you don?t solve a problem his way, it?s wrong. Scratch work policy is the dumbest thing I have ever seen. Don?t ask him questions. He will not understand the question. When he does try to explain it, he will confuse you even more and confuse himself too.

Book is a must.  9 Quizzes (after each section) and 3 or 4 Tests.  Cannot simplify or clarify when asked questions and is very picky about how he likes things done (will take off points if they are not done according to the "check list").  Do not take if you already struggle with math.

Bring book every day, "a little quiz" after EVERY section, tests pretty hard. Requirements are clear & on a checklist on his website, but there are a ton & if you don't do every single one he counts off. Long-winded, not creative with explanations (reads straight from text), self-important, very boring. Not helpful with accommodations at all.

His rule about no scratch work is ridiculous. He takes 20 minutes explaining a problem which any normal teacher could say in about 2 minutes. He likes to talk about the "Philosophy" of math when nobody cares. I learn the lessons on my own, because he is no help.

This guy SUCKS! Only wants the problems worked out HIS way only! He goes all around the world to explain something that takes a few minutes to do BUT you can't do it your way, ONLY HIS! I think he is the kind of teacher that is so smart til he is dumb. No common sense type professor! I drop the third day. I smelled an "F" lurking. BEWARE FOLKS!
Wants the work done his way, period. No room for any other methods and takes off points for such.
